instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message:
Hey all. a1466

History: waterdamaged

- ultrasonic cleaned
- inspected under micro scope

everything seems ok but i have a problem with lcd backlight. it seems to have waves/black spots. it only come half way on the lower left. Is it possible to fix?

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message: Check LED returns on the LCD connector and their corresponding resistors and traces for continuity

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message: No need to check the resistors, just diode mode all the LED return pins on the LCD connector. They should all read the same. Could be corroded connector/resistor/trace or LP8550.

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30433"]No need to check the resistors, just diode mode all the LED return pins on the LCD connector. They should all read the same. Could be corroded connector/resistor/trace or LP8550.[/QUOTE]

i measured all 6 pins they are all around 626~631

no sign of corrosion - water was more on the top side of board + the other end so i suspect it would be LP8550.
I will replace and report back.

Thanks for your help.

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message: No use in replacing it if diode mode reads ok. Tried a known good LCD?

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message: disaster. changed lp8550 now no power. i will replace another one.

threads.title: 820-3437 black spots left side only
threads.message: cry me a river. had LP8550 mounted upside down. soldered it right way now boots but no blacklight? wonder why? :rolleyes: :D:D:D
